Title: The Midnight Detective
Full_Text: Detective Miller arrived [1] the scene of the crime just as the clock struck twelve. The old manor house stood [2] from the road, hidden behind tall iron gates. It looked [3] nobody had lived there for years. He walked [4] the gravel driveway, the stones crunching loudly under his boots. He noticed that a ground-floor window was [5]. It seemed as [6] someone had forced it open with a crowbar. Miller stopped and took [7] his notebook to record the details. He wrote [8] a description of the broken glass. Suddenly, he heard a strange [9] coming from the bushes. He turned [10] around, his hand reaching for his torch. A black cat jumped [11] the garden wall and scurried away into the night. Miller let out a deep [12] of relief; he had been holding his breath. He continued his [13] of the garden. Near the front door, he found a small object lying [14] the grass. It was a [15] button, perhaps dropped by the intruder. He knew then that he would solve the case.
Explanation: We arrive 'at' a specific point or location.

Title: The Midnight Detective
Explanation: Phrasal verb 'stood back' means positioned away from.

Title: The Midnight Detective
Explanation: Preposition indicating movement following a line (the driveway).

Title: The Midnight Detective
Explanation: Adjective describing the state of the window.

Title: The Midnight Detective
Explanation: Movement away from a surface (the wall).

Title: The Midnight Detective
Explanation: We say something is lying 'in' the grass (amongst the blades).

Title: The Midnight Detective
Explanation: Material noun acting as an adjective (e.g.
column12: gold button). 'Golden' usually refers to colour or metaphor.

Title: The Mountain Climb
Full_Text: The mountain [1] high above the clouds, its peak covered in snow. The climbers were [2] to reach the top before sunset. They had [3] for months to build up their strength. The air was thin and it was [4] to breathe. They walked [5] a steady pace, careful not to slip on the icy rocks. After two hours, they stopped to [6] a break. They drank water from their [7] and ate some energy bars. The view from the side of the mountain was [8]. They could see for [9] across the valley below. The wind started to [10], making it feel much colder. They put [11] their thick jackets and zipped them up tight. "We must keep going," said the leader. They finally [12] the summit just as the sun began to set. They felt a huge sense of [13]. It was a day to [14] forever. They promised they would do it all [15] next year.
Explanation: Intransitive verb (past tense of rise). 'Raised' requires an object.

Title: The Mountain Climb
Explanation: Transitive verb (does not need a preposition). 'Arrived' needs 'at'.
